results.description:
Boat tours are $12 for adults, $10 for seniors (62+), $8 for students and youths (age 6-16), and free for children 5 and under.

Boat tours are on an open-topped boat, and the tours run rain or shine. For the best tour experience, plan for the weather and be sure to have sunscreen, a hat or other head covering, and plenty of water with you. The specific route for boat tours may change due to the weather or to changing levels of water in the river or the canals. Occasionally, tours may be cancelled due to the weather or water levels. If you have any questions about your tour, please call the park at (978) 970-5000.

I'm limiting the number of attendees because the boats aren't that big.  But it's just a canal, not the open ocean, right?

http://www.nps.gov/lowe/planyourvisit/guidedtours.htm

results.description: Wanted to reach out to you about a Mushroom Hunt that deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum is hosting in August - it is free and we'd love your community to join! August 9, 2015, 10:30 am—1 pm Join artist Wendy Jacob and the Boston Mycological Club for a mushroom hunt in the Sculpture Park. The event begins with a search of the grounds for mushrooms and other fungi at 10:30 am; participants reconvene at 12 pm to identify findings. Please bring a basket and a brown bag lunch. The Boston Mycological Club (BMC) is the oldest mycological club in North America. Every Sunday, from early July though late October, the club hosts mushroom forays in wooded areas throughout the greater Boston area. This program is free. Please tell the attendant at the Visitor Station that you are here for the Mushroom Foraging program; you will not be charged admission. http://www.decordova.org/calendar/mushroom-fora...­
results.name: Mushroom Hunt that deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum

results.description:
This event opens to rsvp'ing 10 days in advance.

The trail is 8.5 miles from Arlington center to Bedford and we ride at a moderate pace.This event auto-repeats monthly and may be leaderless.

Lunch afterwards at Not Your Average Joes, 645 Mass Ave.

Suggested donation $1 for Meetup fees.

This ride happens only if its a nice, clear day above 40 .

Wear a helmet, bring water and sunscreen, watch out for children on the trail, and have a good time!

 

The Minuteman Bikeway passes through the historic area where the American Revolution began in April 1775.

Today, the Minuteman Bikeway is one of the most popular and successful rail-trails in the United States, enjoyed for both healthy recreation and transportation.

The bikeway has become a new type of “Main Street” where neighbors and strangers alike come together while riding, walking, or skating on the path.

In 2008, Rails-to-Trails Conservancy inducted the Minuteman Bikeway into the national Rail-Trail Hall of Fame.

results.description:
The sailing event is free. The $25 fee is for the Boston Social Sailing T-Shirt that you will get when we board a boat. 

This social activity is completely voluntary, and not-for-profit: no compensation of any kind is required or expected for participation. By boarding my boat, you explicitly agree to assume full personal responsibility for your own safety and well-being, and indemnify me against any legal liability.

Spread the message of free and fun sailing adventures! 

Hanes Cool Dri Performance Shirt 

Available in small, medium, large, xl, and xxl - $25 each

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sailing Info 

Please read disclaimer at the bottom of the page before you RSVP

Who can come
Everybody is invited.
I will be skippering the boat in and out of the mooring field and will be taking over when needed. Once we are in clear waters we will be taking turns at the tiller.


Where
We will be sailing in the Boston inner harbor, and might venture out and sail around one of the Boston Harbor Islands.


What 

- we will sail on
Boston 27 (Based on Soling) , Sonar, or Soling. You can learn more about these boats here: http://www.bostonharborsailing.com/fleet_boston27.html


- to expect
A laid back and safe sailing adventure to the extent it is possible on the racing boat without the engine or bathroom in the busy harbor.

In perfect conditions Boston 27 is a comfortable boat to sail on, but in the strong winds boat will lean and you might get splashed. On a windy day be prepared to pull on the ropes, move around, get splashed, and not have much down-time.

Be warned that it can get stressful at times and we will need to react quickly. . Remember, these boats don’t have engines and we will have to rely on the wind power. During stressful situations it is important to stay calm and to work as a team.

- will be on the boat
Two flotation pillows and four life jackets.


- is important
Safety will be our number one priority. I will give a safety crash course once we are on the boat. I recommend that everyone wears a life jacket.


- to bring
Sunscreen, hat, sunglasses, water, and a cell phone. Sailing Boston 27 or Soling on a windy day can get you splashed. I would recommend bringing a change of clothes and getting a waterproof case for you cell phone or wrapping it in a plastic bag.


- I will bring
My own gear, two-way UHF floating radio pre-programmed with the sailing club and Coast Guard channels and a winch handle to help tighten the sails.


Disclaimer
Sailing can be and will be stressful at times.
It is unlikely but is possible to sustain an injury during sailing. I will try to ensure that we have a safe sailing adventure but be advised that getting scratched or hurt occasionally is part of the sport.
results.how_to_find_us: Let's meet under the archway at the Rowes Wharf
results.name: Sail Around Boston Harbor and a T-Shirt - New Members

results.description:
Were restarting the session curriculum, so if you haven't come before heres a perfect first session!! Those who have been in attendance will be put on an advanced track for the session.

This weeks session is vaulting, getting over obstacles quickly and effeciently.

What if I've never done anything like Parkour before? 


This class, Parkour 101, is a introductory level class. We will be focusing more on learning how to move our body, understand our limits and get a solid understanding of how to train safe rather than jumping straight into super-high level flips and jumps. 

What if I'm a gymnast/marine/stuntman/etc? I don't want to be bored.

Our program prides itself on scaling classes to each and every student. With something like Parkour there are many levels and progressions to each movement. It's very common to in the same class have one student working on perfecting their roll, and on the other side of the room have another student practicing very high-level acrobatics. They both come from the same foundation, but are scaled to each practitioners skill level. 

What do I need to bring/prepare?

The great thing about Parkour is its accessibility. You really only need a good pair of shoes. We recommend a shoe that is made for urban running (no aggressive treads, a smoother sole lightweight). Think hiking boots, crocs, skate shoes are all no-nos. 

Other than that, dress appropriately for activity. Shorts, sweats, t-shirts are all good here. Jeans are normally not the best choice. 

We highly recommend bringing water, snacks and a form of transportation (bike, longboard, potentially train fare)

We will be charging a $5 per class fee to start here, and for the 1 hour 15 minute class we think this isn't too ridiculous. We accept cash or card day of. 

Anything else?

These jams will be run outdoors, and with existing architecture. While we won't be getting into anything crazy, injuries are to be expected. Scrapes happen. We will have first aid available, but make sure you are thinking clearly and in your limits before training! 

I am available to answer all questions, but I hope to see a whole bunch of you out in a few weeks!! 

Be sure to check us out on:

https://www.facebook.com/ParkourAndTricking

https://instagram.com/projectfreerun


http://www.projectfreerun.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the main courtyard up the stairs. The location itself is of concrete construction, and has yellow rails!

results.description:
Our services have three parts: Healing Service, a Lecture on a spiritual topic, and Mediumship Spirit Communication. Each part lasts approximately 30 minutes.

The Healing Service gives you the opportunity to receive healing energy that is channeled through one of our Healers. We believe that healing can be channeled through thought to those who need it. This is a very calming experience, whether or not you choose to sit in a healing chair.  We encourage you to send healing to your loved ones, our communities, and Mother Earth.

The Lecture covers a variety of topics ranging from the History of Spiritualism to Inspired Insights. It also includes examples of how Spiritualism is a part of our lives on a daily basis.

Mediumship, or Spirit Communication, is the part of the service where a medium proves that "...the existence and personal identity of the individual continue after the change called death." The medium might be a member of our church or visiting from another the Spiritualist church in the community. We also have mediums from abroad stop in often. While there is only enough time during a service for a few people to receive messages from their deceased loved ones on the Higher side Side of Life, everyone present benefits by witnessing proof of the continuation of life.

At the conclusion of the service everyone is invited to our social hour downstairs for coffee and conversation.﻿

Lets do a nice long ride at F. Gilbert Hills State Forest. They have charcoal grills we can use. We will ride go out for lunch after

Lets meet a 11:15 and head out by 11:30.. Ride for a couple of hours and go for lunch when get back..

F. Gilbert Hills SP, also known as Foxboro, is a state park with a plethora of trail conditions, singletrack, and fire roads. Conditions stay relatively dry even during rainy times, and the singletrack is rolling and relatively clear. A hardtail is more than ample to ride on, though a hybrid could make it through. What makes the park so great is the ability to shift up and tear through some outstanding singletrack with great scenery

http://www.nemba.org/trails/massachusetts/f-gilbert-hills-state-forest

results.description:
Come and join us for open board gaming at Excelsior!  They have a large gaming area to seat approximately 50 gamers in addition to a growing board game library that patrons may take right off the library shelf and play at-will.  They have also dedicated their Sunday schedule for just this open board gaming event, so us board gamers will have the pick of the tables during the entirety of the event which happens to run the entire time the shop is open on Sundays.

Attendees are welcome to bring in their own games or use games from the library.  Bobby will also run game demos during the event in case you want to learn a new game or simply try before you buy.

In case you are interested in purchasing the game from the demo session, Excelsior will offer 10% off the price of purchasing a new copy of that game that day on top of the 10% discount they are offer to all MBG members (for a total discount of 20% off).  If for some reason they are out of stock of the demo game and must special order it for you that day, they will order it for you and allow you to take an additional 10% special order discount on top of the previous two discounts for a total discount of 30% off!

Want to special order something that is not the demo game?  Add the base TGA 10% discount and the 10% special order discount together for a total of 20% off any special orders.

Nourishment:  The shop carries various snacks and non-alcoholic beverages if you need something to snack or sip on while you game.  For more substantial food, there are many eateries located within walking distance from the shop on Main Street.

Parking:  Excelsior has an agreement in place with the Jiffy Lube at 3 Powder Mill Road.  Attendees may park in the lot behind the Jiffy Lube building.  From there, it is a short walk across Powder Mill Road to the Excelsior's door on the corner of Powder Mill and Waltham Street, which is the 4-way intersection closest to Jiffy Lube.
results.how_to_find_us: On the corner of Waltham Street and Powder Mill Road, park behind the Jiffy Lube

results.description:
This is the regular meetup on Sundays at noon at Brooklyn Boulders in Somerville.  Meet by the first table/bench thing by the entrance.  Hopefully we'll get a good variety of climbing interests coming so that everyone can follow their climbing passion!

(Credit to Francesco Cardiello for the information below):
BKBS is the gorgeous, new, state-of-the-art climbing gym most convenient to those in the Boston, Cambridge, and Somerville area. Although pricier, it features 60+ feet toproping and lead climbing, a massive 22 x 140 foot bouldering wall (and there's still another upstairs), yoga & fitness classes, a sauna, awesome water fountains that fill your water bottle, a retail store, lounge area, weight room, and a soon to open cafe! There's even a collaborative work space where you can study, work, and climb!
If you are looking for a partner or just want to get your climb on join us on Wednesdays for a fun time.

FAQ:

How do I get there? BKBS is conveniently located within a 10 minute walk of the Porter Square station. Walk down Somerville Avenue and turn right on Properzi way and head all the way down. It is also very bike accessible. If you drive, you can find the lot at 30 Dane St. It is located next to Artisans Asylum.

Why should I do this meetup? Since BKBS is such a new community (opened in late July 2013) few people have developed regular climbing partners to train and climb with. This is a great opportunity to meet other climbers interested in BKBS. Climbing is an inherently social sport - to top rope and do lead, you need to meet people who are dedicated to climbing. The Wednesday meetup assures you'll meet a partner to regularly climb with. We are looking to expand to other nights in the future.

What if I haven't climbed before? First off, don't be intimidated. Everyone started somewhere. If you have never belayed before, please make sure to take the Learn the Ropes class. More info can be found here: http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before using the walls. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need? You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time? Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): Day Pass - $25 (Students $18)
10 Pack - $200 (Students $169)

RENTALS: Shoes - $5
Harness - $5
Chalk Bag - $2
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Sunday

results.description:
We have rented 3 badminton courts at the BU Fitness & Recreation Center (regulation full sized courts).  The BU facility is immaculate and a fantastic place to play.


The fee (payable online when you RSVP) gets you into the BU Fitness & Recreation Center to play badminton for an hour and a half.  Part of the fee is for the court time and the rest is for your meetup group to cover other expenses, i.e. rackets, shuttlecocks/birdies, meetup.com fees. All fees collected go to pay the Group's expenses.

We have rackets and shuttles for everyone!

Expect to play doubles. The host can help to match up pairs but members are free to join in any game they want.  The courts are reserved only for Boston Badminton members.

Before asking a question, please read through the following FAQs:

Q: The meetup is full, can I come regardless and pay at the event?
A: No, there is limited space to make sure everyone gets to play. A few spots typically open up before the event.

Q: It's my first time, how do I find you?
A: Go to the BU Fitness & Recreation Center reception (see directions below), and tell them you're here with Boston Badminton. They'll tell you where the courts are, check you're on the list, and make you sign a waiver. The meeting point is on the courts.

Q: I am a BU student, do I get a discount?
A: No, BU charges us the same regardless of whether participants are at BU or not.


Directions:
Please click here for a google map to The BU Fitness & Recreation Center.  The easiest way to get to the FitRec center from within Boston is to take the Green Line (B)-Boston College to Saint Paul St.  Parking is limited but available.  Please click here for parking information.

Plan to grab a drink locally after if we have interest.

The club has full locker room and shower facilities.

Note: In addition to agreeing to the Meetup's Liability Waiver, all members must sign a Waiver of Liability Form in order to use BU's courts. This form is available at the front desk at the FitRec center.  We may ask you for your full name in order to help BU and the meetup comply with the liability procedures.

Let me know if you have any questions and I hope to see you there!

Liability Waiver

By attending a Boston Badminton meetup, you hereby agree to the terms of the following Liability Waiver:

The purpose of the following Liability Waiver is to protect Boston Badminton meetup members and group leaders from liability in case of accident or injury. All members must agree to the Liability Waiver in order to participate in the group and its activities.

As part of my membership to Boston Badminton on Meetup.com (hereinafter “Boston Badminton”), I hereby freely and voluntarily agree to the following Release, Acknowledgment of Risk, and Waiver of Liability:

In consideration of the opportunity to participate in events, activities, classes, and programs conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates in any venue, and to use equipment located therein, I, on behalf of myself and my minor children, do hereby release, hold harmless and forever discharge and agree not to sue Boston Badminton and its trustees, officers, agents, founders, members, volunteers and employees (together, "Meetup.com Group") from any and all claims, responsibilities or liabilities for injury or damages resulting from or arising out of my or my family’s use of, presence in, or participation in activities conducted at any venue rented or owned by Boston Badminton, whether or not caused by the ordinary negligence of Boston Badminton. I understand, recognize and acknowledge that certain activities conducted by Boston Badminton or taking place in venues rented or owned by Boston Badminton are potentially hazardous. I also acknowledge that it is my responsibility to follow instructions for any activity or use of equipment, and to seek help from the volunteers if I have any questions. I further understand that, notwithstanding precautions taken by Boston Badminton, sports and fitness activities involve a risk of injury and/or death. I/we are voluntarily participating in these activities and using equipment and machinery with knowledge of the dangers involved. I hereby agree to expressly assume and accept any and all risks associated with my participation in activities conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates. I have read the foregoing and hereby agree to be bound by same.

results.description:
Our Speaker will be Owen!

What wonders are to be found in the complex plane?  We all know and love the famous Mandelbrot set, but that is just the beginning. Owen will start with a review of some special functions and how they behave in the complex plane. He'll describe the common features they can have, such as poles and essential singularities, and explain what a "residue" is. Then he will present some of his gorgeous phase portraits, which are one of the best ways we have for trying to visualise complex functions.

**************************************************************

A NOTE ON THE LOCATION: For first-timers, getting into the building can be a bit tricky. See this page for a map and explanation.
results.name: Visualising special functions: Phase portraits in the complex plane

1:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

1:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

3:00 - Conclude the meetup with snacks and socializing


Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white t-shirt and a colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a dark or white "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, pinnies, sunscreen, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

results.description:
Diane here...

Join me for an afternoon/evening of writing, for however long you like, and some socializing on the roofdeck of my apartment. I'm moving in a few weeks, so I thought it would be fun to enjoy the deck with a party or two!

There will be places to write inside (dining room table, coffee table, power strips) and a table/umbrella on top if you're so inclined. Around 7:30 as the sun goes down, up top will turn into socializing, but feel free to write as long as you like inside or out. We can enjoy the sunset and then the city lights. 

I'll have a couple bottles of wine, water, and some light snacks to share, but feel free to contribute snacks or beverages of your own.

I'll send out a message the day before giving entry instructions to those who have RSVP'd 'yes'.  Street parking is sporadic in the area (though possible on South Street), but arriving by T (South Station) is by far the easiest and cheapest way to get here. There is also parking on top of South Station as well as in the Chinatown Garage, entering at 86 Beach Street.

Special Note: for those of you with allergies, we have a cat! She'll spend most of the evening in a bedroom, but I wanted to forewarn you.


Happy Writing!

Diane

results.description:
Concluding our foray along the Freedom Trail, we will be meeting to sketch the commons and the Massachusetts State House (The silly big gilded dome!)


We will meet at 2pm in the corner of the Commons closest to the state house. 

At 4pm we will reconvene in the same corner to share and chat about our work.

I encourage people to disperse through the park to sketch some of the attractions: the frog pond, the bandstand, etc. The park should be quite active, with plenty of shady nooks for sketching. This will also be an excellent setting to practice composition of foreground and background, as well as focal points, since the park has long views across and back into the city.

From wikipedia:

"The Massachusetts State House, also known as the Massachusetts Statehouse or the "New" State House, is the state capitol and house of government of the Commonwealth of Massachussetts, located in the Beacon Hill neighborhood of Boston. The building, designed by noted architect Charles Bulfinch, was completed in 1798, and has repeatedly been enlarged since. It is considered a masterpiece of Federal Architecture and among Bulfinch's finest works."

The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the essential life energy within.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

Sunday, August 9, 2015 at 3:30 p.m. at Grasshopper in Boston 

Slick Facts: Truth & Myth Around Dietary Fats
with Mona Sigal, M.D. 

Dr. Sigal's talk for BVS in January was so popular, we knew we had to have her back, and twice! 

So, the same presentation will be offered, for free: 

Sunday, August 9, 4 p.m. at Grasshopper in Boston (details will be sent in August) 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Dr. Sigal was Chief of Emergency Services at North Shore Medical Center, Salem Hospital, Medical Director at North Shore EMS in Salem MA, and Staff Lecturer at Northeastern University. She earned a Certificate in Plant Based Nutrition from Cornell University, and is Certified in Nutrition and Lifestyle Medicine by the Wellness Forum Institute in Ohio. She is a Certified Food for Life Instructor by the Physicians Committee for Responsible Medicine. She was a visiting physician with the John McDougall MD Residential Patient Program. 


As Founder and Medical Director of Nourish Health with Food For Life in Peabody MA, Dr. Sigal practices office based nutrition and lifestyle medicine. She also teaches the Food For Life curricula in the community, and lectures throughout the North Shore on plant based nutrition, disease prevention, arrest and reversal, and the connection between nutrition and disease evolution. Dr. Sigal testified in front of the USDA 2015 Dietary Guidelines Advisory Committee in Washington DC.
results.name: Slick Facts: Truth & Myth Around Dietary Facts, with Mona Sigal, MD

This is a "low intermediate and up" level meetup. We play on grass on a men's height net. We will start with warm-up and a hitting line, followed by 6:6 play.

Low Intermediate -- players who can consistently bump, set, spike, and serve. Moderate pace; laid-back game.

Location: Grass fields at Sidney and Pacific Street in Cambridge.

Access by T: Central Square stop. Walk down Mass Ave towards MIT, make a right on Sidney Street, and walk down about four blocks to Pacific Street. It's about a 5-10 minute walk from the T stop.

Parking: There are spots on one side of Tudor Street between Sidney and Brookline that are free to park at on weekends. It is the side of the street opposite the side with the parking meters.

We have had a long waitlist the past few Sundays, so please make sure that you RSVP only if you can come, and show up on time if you have RSVP'ed. Due to high demand, we are putting in place a priority rule for those who show up consistently and on time. If there is a waitlist, no-shows from the previous week get lower priority. It counts as a no-show for waitlist purposes if you change your RSVP to "no" less than 24 hours before the start time or arrive late for the actual game after warm-up.

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE: Tavern in the Square in Porter Square

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Look down the street. There's Tavern in the Square! If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Erika and Jack
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,

Let's take a French cooking class at the Sur La Table.  This class takes place on Sunday, August 9, at 5 pm.  

The class is limited to 16 people and registration is first come, first serve.  Classes often sell-out.  If you are seriously interested in participating in this event, please don't wait too long to make your reservation.  The cost is $69 and the price includes the lesson and all materials.   You may register on-line at http://www.surlatable.com/sku/2179059/French+Country+Favorites or via phone at [masked] or [masked]-5197. 

Sur La Table will refund your tuition in full for cancellations made up to 48 hours before the class. No refunds or credits will be given for a cancellation made less than 48 hours before the class. Cancellations or changes can be made in your local store or through their toll-free number,[masked]-0852.   

What You Will Learn


Menu: Provençal Marinated Olives - Grilled Steak and Eggplant Brochettes with Saffron Aioli - Tomato, Cucumber, Chèvre Salad with Preserved Lemon Vinaigrette - Plum Clafoutis

Class Description: This summer, take a vacation from your ordinary dinner fare and treat your family to authentic dishes from the sunny south of France. In this fun, hands-on class, our instructor will introduce you to traditional French flavors with a menu featuring fresh, seasonal produce. You'll learn techniques for everything from perfectly grilling steak to creating a creamy garlic sauce accented with saffron. Plus, we'll share secrets for making your own vinaigrette from scratch and preparing a classic French country dessert—clafoutis with fresh summer fruit.


What To Expect: Great cooking isn't about recipes—it's about techniques. In our classes you'll work together with other students in a fun, hands-on environment led by our professional chef instructors.

Classes are hands-on and  2 to 2 1/2 hours.  You will work with other students in groups of 4.  You will be standing, cooking and working for most of the class.  Please wear comfortable, closed-toe shoes and have long hair tied back.  You will enjoy a generous taste of every dish.  

<a>http://www.surlatable.com/browse/storeCalendar.jsp?storeId=123</a>;


I look forward to enjoying this event with the group.

Joana
results.name: French Country Favorites Cooking Class at the Sur La Table

Please meet up at the Starbucks with the Steaming Kettle at 63 Court Street (next to the Government MBTA station). This is the Starbucks with the Giant Golden Steaming Tea Kettle which hangs above the front entrance.

If you take public transportation the Haymarket or State subway stations (orange line) are less than a five (5) minute walk.


If you need to drive the most convenient parking is at Center Plaza an underground garage with entry on Cambridge Street.

</a>

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

<a href="https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com">https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com


(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Babylon. 323 BC.

The mighty emperor Alexander the Great, fresh off of conquering Asia Minor, Mesopotamia, Syria, Persia and Egypt, and spreading Hellenistic civilization to the four quarters of his realm, sits down, gets his drink on, and dies around two weeks later.

Bummer.

Double bummer is that our man Alex, still being quite the young fellow, did not leave an heir who was of age. The theory is that his generals will loyally keep the peace and protect his heirs and other family members until they are old enough to take the reins of his vast empire, and CERTAINLY NOT try to carve off a mighty kingdom of their very own from some choice bits that just happen to be exactly where their loyal troops just happen to be standing.

That's the theory. History teaches how well this theory usually works in practice.

In Successors, you control two of those generals, and you have a choice: you can be a loyal champion of the late emperor's family and gain Legitimacy Points by protecting the young heirs and carrying Alexander's funeral cart from Babylon back to the Macedonian capital city, Pella, or you can stake out a position as a successor to Alexander's throne (by right of We Can Beat You Up) by gaining control of provinces and claiming Victory Points. You can win instantly by passing a VP or LP threshold, you can win by controlling one of the heirs at the start of the appropriate turn AND having the most VP and LP combined, or you can win at the end of five turns by having the most VP.

To me, this sounds like Game of Thrones with fewer nude scenes but better hummous. Does it sound good to you? Let's play.

We'll be meeting at Pandemonium for this one. It's two blocks from the Central Square Red Line stop. The Open Gaming begins at Pandemonium at 6 but I'd like to get there a little early (this hasn't historically been an issue, most of the time) to aid in teaching the game with enough time left over to play the thing, so please shoot for 5:30 if at all possible.
results.how_to_find_us: We're in the gaming area downstairs
results.name: Let's Play Successors!

results.description:
Sunday Night "CONCERTS ON THE COMMON" Series in North Andover

August 9:  The Riverboat Stompers (  7-pc Dixieland)  Jazz Band

TIME:  Meet Up time - 5:30 pm

  Music Begins at : 6:00 pm

COST:  Free

Bring a chair or blanket to sit on... pack a cooler with a picnic supper or snacks, beverages, and bug repellant ( if you need it). Let's spend a relaxing evening listening to music  on the common!

* PLEASE NOTE: These concerts are usually well-attended. So, try to be there at the time posted... I will have a MEET UP SIGN on the back of my chair.  This is an all outdoor venue. RAIN CANCELS. If the weather is questionable, please be sure to check for any updates prior to heading out

*ADDRESS: North Andover Common is at the corner of Mass Ave. & Osgood Streets

*This is a shared event with other meet up groups I've invited

results.description:
“Fearlessness in those without power is maddening to those who have it.” --from This Boy's Life


This unforgettable memoir, by one of our most gifted writers, introduces us to the young Toby Wolff, by turns tough and vulnerable, crafty and bumbling, and ultimately winning. Separated by divorce from his father and brother, Toby and his mother are constantly on the move, yet they develop an extraordinarily close, almost telepathic relationship. As Toby fights for identity and self-respect against the unrelenting hostility of a new stepfather, his experiences are at once poignant and comical, and Wolff does a masterful job of re-creating the frustrations and cruelties of adolescence. His various schemes - running away to Alaska, forging checks, and stealing cars - lead eventually to an act of outrageous self-invention that releases him into a new world of possibility.
results.name: Wolff: This Boy's Life

group.name: Classic Books: A Book Club for Voracious Readers

venue.name: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138

results.description:
Let's join 20+ walkers and some other walking groups for:

Over 2 years of reliable walking

Please note that this walk does not start at the same place as the other Fresh Pond walk.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

results.description:
</a>

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

<a href="https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com">https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com


(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>
results.name: Speeddating Ages 25-35 - SOLD OUT FOR MEN

results.description:
Let's join 20+ others from six other walking groups for:

Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

results.description:
For details check out http://reggaeintheparkboston.com

Buy your ticket online here, http://www1.ticketmaster.com/event/01004EBD834F1762

Everyone enters through the Zebra entrance of the Zoo which is closest to the Blue Hill Avenue and Columbia Road intersection.

BE CONCERT READY BY READING THE RULES BELOW

*** WEATHER***

★ Rain or Shine concert (0% chance of rain as of noon Sat Aug 8th)

*** NO RE-ENTRY ALLOWED***

*** NO ATMS INSIDE THE VENUE ***

You MUST be at least TWENTY-ONE years old to enter.

You MUST show proper identification upon entry

Acceptable identification include and limited to:

 ★ Passports

 ★ Permanent Resident/Alien ID Cards

 ★ State Issued Drivers Licenses (non-expired)

 ★ State Issued ID's (non-expired)

Birth documents/papers and Learner's Permits are NOT ACCEPTABLE

*** SECURITY CHECKPOINT & PROCESS ***

*** EVERYONE AND THEIR ITEMS WILL BE INSPECTED ***

★ "Airport styled" search upon entry into the park will be conducted.

★ There will be a "by-pass" line for those patrons who are coming "concert ready".

R E G G A E I N T H E P A R K Concert ready means:

NO chairs

NO handbags (such as large pocketbooks/knapsacks/school bags)

★ All patrons and their bags must have a wristband

NO EXCEPTIONS

If you carry only a wristlet you are concert ready 


*** THESE ITEMS ARE STRICTLY PROHIBITED***

 ★ Food, Water, Soda, Alcohol, Weapons


*** REFRESHMENTS ***

★ NO beverages of any kind (non-alcoholic or alcoholic) will be allowed inside

This inlcudes WATER which will be provided once inside

★ Refreshment bars will be available.

*** FOOD VENDORS WILL BE ONSITE *** 

 *** PERMISSABLE ITEMS ***

★ For your comfort, lounge chairs will be allowed into the park, one chair per person

★ For your safety, every chair will be subjected to a thorough search. Please be advised that security regulations mandate that we must search all chairs. We must open, close and safety check the chairs before you enter. This could potentially delay your entry to the park significantly (tested wait time=approx. 45 minutes). Please consider your options before electing to bring a chair.


Here is a message from Lion Entertainment, the promoter:


In celebration of the city of Boston rich cultural history, Lion Entertainment Boston Premier Promotional Powerhouse, annually host Reggae in the Park in the lovely greeting area grounds of the Franklin Park Zoo. An event which took years in the making, Reggae in the Park, demanded the combined efforts of the leadership team of the Franklin Park Zoo, commanding officers of the Massachusetts State Police and stewardship of key members of the city of Boston to make the landmark event work. Reggae in the Park is a "Coachella type" park gathering where people of all walks of life can gather and enjoy the sweet, soothing sounds of top performing artists who perform the genre of music commonly known as Reggae - popular in the Caribbean diaspora and originating from Jamaica.

Popular artists such as Beres Hammond, Morgan Heritage and more are a few that have graced the stage much to the delight of thousands of adoring fans.

Reggae in the Park fuses multi-generational gaps; genders, ages, cultures all come together to pay tribute to music adding to the thread that weaves the cloth of "togetherness and diversity" within the city of Boston. Slated annually at the beginning of the summer months, Reggae in the Park is an event that encourages attendees to bring out their lounge chairs, sample Caribbean cuisine and take a journey to the Caribbean islands through song, dance and networking.

For a short 4-5 hour time-frame, patrons are treated to true "island life" in their North American homeland.

The team at Lion Entertainment remain extremely grateful to the authorities and the patrons alike who attend this event every year since 2014. Relatively incident-free, Reggae in the Park has been given its approval again this year, and on Sunday August 9, we look forward to welcoming award winning musical acts to the city of Boston for another memorable performance.

We look forward to seeing YOU and your family & friends at Reggae in the Park 2015!

Most real estate agents have 2 revenue streams:

1. Working with buyers to purchase a home for them to live in and

2. Working with sellers by listing and their home.

Learn how to add additional revenue streams to your real estate business by attending this lunch and learn event hosted by Tom Cafarella of Ocean City Development. The presentation will focus on adding additional revenue streams to your real estate brokerage business including:

1.Making money by helping us acquire properties: Think it would be easier to approach an expired listing or FSBO with an offer in hand from a cash buyer? We'll show you how to easily get in front of more sellers.
2.Our Automated Short Sale System:Learn how to capitalize on short sales while keeping your sanity. Our automated short sale program allows agents to spend a very limited amount of time and effort while maximizing their commissions.
3.Buyer Lead Overflow:we don't work with buyers, but that doesn't mean you shouldn't. Learn how working with an investor can provide you with an overflow of buyer leads and how we generate these leads(mostly by accident).
4.Learn how to make money by wholesaling properties & raising capital: we'll show you how to easily and effectively add these two revenue streams to your real estate business.

As an added bonus, we will be reviewing our best practices and systems to allow you to leverage your time and efforts in 2015.

Tom is a principle of Ocean City Development and is head of acquisitions. Tom has been on the front lines of Ocean City Development's team, and has acquired over 62 properties to fix and flip over the past 12 months

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
READ THIS CAREFULLY PLEASE:

I'm glad to be able to host a team as I work at MIT as a Data Scientist. The team has 4 more spots for you all. If you are very interested and willing to contribute, please make sure to shoot me a message and tell me about your skill-sets. 

Otherwise you may try to join as individual. I also highly encourage you to use the "Discussions" panel if you would like to organize your own team, in care you are in MIT community!


Register here:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/solve-a-thon-2015-tickets-17756933466

Solve-a-thon
In October, MIT will convene extraordinary people to work on extraordinary problems facing our world in the areas of Cure, Fuel, Learn, and Make.

Join us August 10th and 11th for a Solve-a-thon to put MIT’s collaborative and cross-disciplinary problem-solving approach into action and see how your ideas could impact future generations for the better!

The two-day event allows team of 3-6 to work on a Solve-inspired challenge. Teams will collaborate on the problem on Day 1 and regroup on Day 2 to present their proposals to a panel of esteemed judges. Cash prizes will be awarded to the top three teams.


The Challenge
“Wearable technology” has advanced to the point where we can answer phone calls from our wrists, track every step taken throughout the day, monitor vital signs, and control delivery of insulin to manage diabetes. Managing and analyzing the vast amount of data collected by these wearable devices is an increasingly complex challenge that has the potential to make powerful contributions to the field of medicine.

In order to gain wide adoption and become a valuable tool in healthcare, wearable medical devices must:

• Provide enough useful pieces of information to physicians over long periods of time

• Be comfortable, compact, and user-friendly in order to facilitate everyday use

• Be affordable and accessible to populations for whom collected medical data could lead to an increase in quality of life

• Be augmented by meaningful data analytics and information to incite use by both physician and patient

For this Solve-a-thon, your task is to develop a concept and distribution plan for a wearable device that could significantly improve delivery of targeted healthcare to a significant portion of the world’s population. A successful proposal will include a discussion of the data to be collected by the device, engineering feasibility, a simple sketch model, market and distribution benchmarks, and a plan for encouraging long-term usage by diverse population groups.

Solve-a-thon Teams
Sign up as a team or register as an individual to be assigned to a group. Teams must have no more than six members and should include representatives from at least three of the MIT schools: SA+P, Engineering, SHASS, Sloan, and Science. All members of the MIT community are welcome.

Time and Location
August 10, 2015 | 5:00-9:00pm

Sala de Puerto Rico, W20-202

Meet other student Solvers over dinner and refreshments and gather with your team to begin to explore the problem and identify a solution.

August 11, 2015 | 5:00-8:30pm, social afterward

Wong Auditorium, E15-115

Present your proposal to a panel of judges from academia and industry, who will assess the potential success of your idea. Cash prizes will be awarded to the top three teams. Dinner provided!

About the Organizers

Solve is an action-oriented event focused on using technology and innovative thinking to address and solve the world’s greatest challenges. Solve is produced by MIT Technology Review in partnership with the Institute’s Office of the President. To learn more about how you can help solve the world’s biggest problems, contact us at [masked].


If you are interested in meeting some of the most prominent problem-solvers in the world at the Solve event on October 5-8, learn about volunteer opportunities!
results.name: MIT wearable device Solve-a-thon

It's Summer and finally the hot weather is here! Let's enjoy a FREE summer concert sponsored by the Town of Danvers, MA.


Don’t Call Me Shirley plays contemporary, popular, and classic hits from the 1950’s to today’s favorites.  We play popular music from a cross section of many genres and decades. DCMS is "a wicked fun band" that entertains music lovers with a wide range of tastes. Shirley is a truly entertaining party band for the local lounge or the backyard blow-out, your favorite night club or a surprise party to remember. 

Band starts at 6pm and ends at 8pm. We will meet at 5:30 to make sure we get a spot.

Rain cancels/Rain date is August 11th for this band/concert series.

Check out all the Danvers concerts here

Not T accessible.

Free parking on street.

I think they have food trucks or local sub shops in that area in case folks wanted to eat while they watch the concert.

Where we will be: At the Danvers Rotary Pavillion, on the lawn of the Peabody Institute Library. Don't forget your lawn chair.


Check out the band website: http://www.dontcallmeshirley.info/index.html

See you there!

results.description:
THE MAN FROM U.N.C.L.E.

Henry Cavill ("Man of Steel") stars as Napoleon Solo opposite Armie Hammer ("The Social Network") as Illya Kuryakin in director Guy Ritchie's action adventure "The Man from U.N.C.L.E.," a fresh take on the hugely popular 1960s television series.

Set against the backdrop of the early 1960s, at the height of the Cold War, "The Man from U.N.C.L.E." centers on CIA agent Solo and KGB agent Kuryakin. Forced to put aside longstanding hostilities, the two team up on a joint mission to stop a mysterious international criminal organization, which is bent on destabilizing the fragile balance of power through the proliferation of nuclear weapons and technology. The duo's only lead is the daughter of a vanished German scientist, who is the key to infiltrating the criminal organization, and they must race against time to find him and prevent a worldwide catastrophe.

RATED PG-13 FOR ACTION VIOLENCE, SOME SUGGESTIVE CONTENT, AND PARTIAL NUDITY.

IN THEATERS AUGUST 14

http://www.manfromuncle.com 

#ManfromUNCLE

https://youtu.be/CzYRlISYE8Y
results.name: THE MAN FROM U.N.C.L.E.! (Monday August 10th at 7pm - AMC Boston)

results.description:
City Awake is excited to announce the launch of one of its 2015 initiatives,Boston Impact Guild, and to invite passionate volunteers to join our growing team!

      If you want to find out more about the notorious B.I.G. and how you can     
      help strengthen the greater Boston social impact ecosystem, please 

The Boston Impact Guild is a 2015 initiative of City Awake which seeks to establish Boston as a global capital for social impact by building a vibrant, collaborative ecosystem. We believe that strong relationships are the foundation for this type of community.
City Awake strives to connect Boston’s leaders, thinkers, and do-ers, and to develop partnerships and opportunities for greater impact that extend beyond existing silos.

The Guild will be hosting a Recruitment Open House to share details about upcoming initiatives and to outline how you can join our talented, passionate team in the development and implementation of the Boston Impact Guild!  


City Awake emerged in December 2014, as it launched the ten-day social impact festival. In the belief that the inclusive yet diverse nature of a festival served as the best vehicle to catalyze Boston’s active community, the City Awake Festival brought together 235 partner organizations with a shared a vision of making Boston a capital of social impact work. As a growing organization, City Awake thrives due to the invaluable support of the Boston community, and importantly, as a result of the passion and commitment of its volunteer-driven team. Learn more and join the movement at City Awake!
results.how_to_find_us: City Awake: http://cityawake.is/
results.name: Boston Impact Guild Open House

results.description:
Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. New paddlers welcome at all times of the season.

Mon & Wed: 6pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.  
Sat: 11am - 1pm, meet 10.45am by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.

Price: New paddler 2-class pack for $10. All other paddlers paddle unlimited under the $110 annual membership fee. New paddlers who have purchased the $10 intro pack get a $10 deduction from $110 membership!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather! Be prepared to get wet!

Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards.  
Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended.  
Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen.

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locker provided on-site.

Please sign our e-Waiver before you get on the water

Hope to see you there!

Lily[masked]

 

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

 

Parking: </a>Parking: <a href="http://www.fortpointpier.com/info.php#DirectionsParkingPortage">Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $6 flat rate.

Public Transport: Closest MBTA stop is South Station on the Red Line.
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on the grassy patch between the Children's Museum & the Barking Crab Restaurant
results.name: Monday Water Training

results.description:
I will be there at 5pm.

THIS RIDE IS HOSTED BY NEMBA

RIDE IS DESIGNED TO TEACH AND PRACTICE TECHNIQUE TO RIDERS

Ride meeting time is 5:00PM. Come to the pump track if there is no one in the lot. We will return to the lot at 6PM for anyone who cannot make the 5PM start. Please be ready to ride by 6:15PM.GB & MV NEMBA Monday Night Practice Your Technique Ride

http://www.nemba.org/rides/gb-mv-nemba-monday-night-practice-your-technique-ride

Following a successful pilot in 2013, the weekly GBNEMBA PYT ride (formerly at the Fells on Wednesdays) is now at Russell Mill on Monday nights in collaboration with the Merrimack Valley chapter (MVNEMBA). Russell Mill is a great location for PYT'ing. New this year, thanks to the very kind sponsorship of JRA Cycles, we will be having pizza delivered for immediate post-ride consumption!

Format: PYT = Practice Your Technique. The format is all about building MTB skills: bike handling, body position, sessioning on trail features, braking, climbing, shifting, etc. Russell Mill has a pump track which will be utilized as well. The ride will be led by GB and MV Ride Guides, is no-drop and could best be thought of as "ride, practice a skill, ride some more, practice a skill, etc." More info here

The PYT rides have something for all riders of all abilities and levels. Come out and learn something new or get better at something you are rusty on - and maybe meet some fellow riders to ride with in the future. This is a great way to take your skills up a notch!

What to bring:
1. Mountain bike
2. Helmet (required)
3. Water
4. You!

Ride meeting time is 5:00PM. Come to the pump track if there is no one in the lot. We will return to the lot at 6PM for anyone who cannot make the 5PM start. Please be ready to ride by 6:15PM
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the back end of the parking lot at Russell Mill, Chelmsford MA
results.name: GB & MV NEMBA Monday Night Practice Your Technique Ride-Read Start Time Details

Please come out to our 4th Drink Draw and Tacos event! Come and sketch or get a lesson while you draw, drink and enjoy the best tacos this side of Texas!

Pay what you want- $2 minimum suggested, to attend, or $10 or more for on the spot art instruction. Please pay as you arrive to simplify things.

There will be a band after the drawing session and you are welcome to stick around.

Cuisine En Locale welcomes Boston Sketchers to enjoy an evening in the lounge where we will sketch, doodle, draw in a lush creative environment. They have extended a 10% discount on food for members who register to the event. While we are there, we will be supporting local farms and farmers:

"Using all local ingredients in Massachusetts is no simple task, and we are often asked why we bother.  The simple answer strikes to the heart of the company’s mission: to support the growth of farms and farmers, and increase the value of food in the area where we live, and eat." - Cuisine En Locale

If you are Latina looking to connect with other smart, savvy, and professional Latinas in the greater-Boston area, this is your event!

BeVisible is also excited to announce that we will be joined by Melissa James, President and CEO of The Tech Connection, the premier marketplace for purpose driven diverse technical talent. Melissa will be sharing with us her experiences as a woman of color in the tech sector, and share what has helped her in her career.

results.description:
Fitness doesn’t need to be intimidating or extreme, but it does need to produce good RESULTS! Come join TFW Boston for an after-work happy hour… errr I mean workout. 

Our workouts make will make you BETTER, not just tired, and our fitness familia will help you enjoy your time and ENCOURAGE you to give your best!

What to expect: 

• A challenging, motivating and downright fun environment for training - perfect for after a long work day. 

• Experience the Training For Warriors ‘Hurricane’ workout as seen on ESPN, The New York Times, and Boston Fitness Magazine, and has created world champions in multiple professional sports


• Effective warm-ups to ensure all participants perform optimally and remain injury-free. 

• Sweat, smiles, and lots of high-fives. 

What NOT to expect: 

• Bootcamp instructors barking in your face. 

• Workouts that put exhaustion before results and safety.


• Participants that are there just to feel like they’re better than someone else.

If you want to lose fat or build muscle, build strength, improve confidence and overall health, this is the place to be. Please bring water, workout clothes and shoes, a hand to high-five with, and a friend(if you’d like)
results.name: Outdoor Workout in Dewey Square!

results.description:
Indoor Rock Gym:  Central Rock Gym Watertown Ma (Monday's)

This Meetup is for weekly climbing at the Central Rock Gym in Watertown, MA. This meetup is intended to provide climbing partners for both lead and top rope climbers that sign up for the meetups.

Meet by the cubbies facing the Lead Wall (they will be on the right as you enter). I (Lovey) am usually wearing a teal harness with green & black climbing shoes.  Climb for 1.5 to 3 hrs. Adults of all skill levels and ages welcomed.  

**If you are leading, you should have your own rope. Work it out with your partner as to whose rope you'll be using if only one rope will be used between the two of you. Sometimes lead climbers prefer to lead on their own rope so both lead climbers may bring their own ropes to use. Word of caution: other climbers may help themselves to the second rope when it's not in use.


**If you come late, come find me or ask the CRG staff for help.  They know we climb on Mondays and can help you find the group. 

**There is another meetup group (and perhaps a second) that also climbs Watertown Mondays nights. If you miss the RSVP deadline, would appreciate a courtesy email/call to let me know you'll be joining us so I know to expect you.


**You are required to fill out the rock gym waivers. Go to their website http://www.centralrockgym.com/watertown.php and fill out their Liability Waiver online to save time when you arrive at the gym. 

**It is your responsibility to make sure you have taken the CRG Belay and/or Lead tests. If you have never climbed at CRG, you will be required to take their Belay test given by their staff only. Please make certain to come a bit early to allow for time to take their belay test.

**If you have never belayed before, please make sure to take the "Intro Belay Class". You can sign up for this class (http://www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown under "Climbing Instruction).

**If you are interested in taking their Intro To Leading Climbing class, you can sign up for it at (http://www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown under "Climbing Instruction).

Equipment required: harness, shoes, chalk and belay device. 


Day Passes - $20 (Student/Military: $16)

10-Day Punch card $180 (Student/Military: $144)


Gear Rental:

- $8 Full Package

- $5 Harness

- $5 Shoes

- $2 Chalk

- $2 Belay Device

Membership options and further details are available on the website:http://www.centralrockgym.com/watertown.php

=============================================

Waiver:  Read !!!

Be Warned!

Mountaineering, Skiing – Alpine or Back Country, Rock & Ice Climbing by its very nature is an extremely hazardous activity.

Falling off any part of an climbing route or bouldering challenge or other associated activities, even hiking to a destination may result in injury or death. Weather, Trail conditions be it a slip on a trail or falling objects like rocks, climbing gear or tree’s from above, or avalanche can all incur injuries and/or death. 

Any information on this Meetup group page is for the basic understanding of what could be encountered. We do not guarantee any type of accuracy on this information. Seek your own additional resources of information.  You as an active member! Perhaps, lacking any of the following: professional training, good judgment, moral character or a conscience. We or anyone on any Meetup-Mountaineers cannot be held responsible in anyway.

When arriving at any Meetup you should always use your own best judgment. You must decide whether or not the conditions “ both physical or mental” are in your best interests. 

You cannot blame the organizer(s) if you get hurt. To join this meetup event you must acknowledge that you have read this waiver and thereby you completely and totally agree to indemnify the organizer(s) from any possible legal action related to any type of illness, injury, loss of equipment etc. that might potentially occur. We are not guides or leaders in any event held. Just the organizers of finding a meeting location that people with similar interests can meet and socialize.

That said have fun! Play safely! And take the responsibility of your own actions.


The Organizers…

results.description:
Dr. Jon Grabowski and Dr. Julie Simpson :
Exploring Our Oceans: Ecology of Our Coasts

Join us on August 10th at 7:00pm at the Burren, for Science by the Pint.

Dr. Jon Grabowski of Northeastern University studies ecology in estuarine and marine habitats. His lab asks many exciting questions relevant to our own sea shores outside Boston, and other coastal areas: How do resource availability, habitat degradation and predation risk affect population dynamics, migratory behavior, community structure, and ecosystem functioning? How can these insights inform the conservation biology of economically important species, such as lobster, cod, herring, monkfish, oysters, and seagrass? How do management initiatives such as closed areas, fishing gear modifications, and fishing reductions impact habitat recovery and sustainability of fisheries?

Dr. Julie Simpson of MIT Sea Grant studies the ecology of coastal habitats such as salt marshes. Her diverse projects includes: tracing terrestrial pollutants (metals, fertilizers, pharmacuitcals, etc) and their impacts on these habitats, modeling the effects of climate change on these habitats, measuring ability of eel grasses to store carbon, and designing autonomous vehicles (marine robots) to explore these habitats. As a member of the MIT Sea Grant’s Marine Advisory Services, Julie applies her research to local environmental and economic issues facing our coastal community, and participates in educational programs..


Science by the Pint is sponsored by an organization of Harvard graduate students called Science in the News.  In between their sleepless hours of hard work at Harvard Med School, they bring cutting edge scientific research to the public in a fun and informal format. 


The Burren is located on Elm Street right in the heart of Davis Square, just a short walk from the Red Line stop.  If you prefer to drive, there are metered spots on the stRead more about MIT Sea Grant activities reet and in nearby municipal lots (see link below).  Meters are active until 8:00 PM, and metered spots are free thereafter. Municipal lot meters are good for three hours, and street spots are good for two.

Links:

Grabowski Lab website: links to articles on many of these topics

Read more about MIT Sea Grant activities

SITN Facebook Page

SITN: Science by the Pint

The Burren

Davis Square Parking
