results.description:
Join us for an introduction to this unique Japanese martial art. Participants will all get a chance to practice some basic movements, explore a bit of the underpinning philosophy, and experience seated meditation. In short, we will have fun together learning about this martial way, one unknown to many in the United States. 

Shorinji Kempo is a relatively new martial art. It was founded just after WWII as part of a Zen Buddhist practice. Today, while the martial art has been separated from the religion, the practice of Shorinji Kempo remains true to it's Zen Buddhist roots, with philosophy and meditation still integral to the study in the dojo of hard (punches, kicks and blocks) and soft techniques (releases, joint locks and throws).
results.name: Boston Shorinji Kempo Open Dojo Event

results.description:
Climbing MeetUp at MetroRock Gym in Everett. Toprope, sport leading, and bouldering available, including some tall walls up to 55 feet. Whether you're a new or experienced climber, join us for a fun and solid workout! We usually have people at all levels. Gym meetups are also a great way to make more friends for outdoor climbing. Plus Mondays are ladies night: discounted admission. If you'd like to lead climb, don't forget to bring your rope :)

*** If you are new to MetroRock Gym and/or climbing, please see the FAQ below. ***

Meet at the picnic tables near bouldering area (the one furthest from the cubbies if available) from 7 - 7:10 PM.  (NOTE: In the rare case the Event Host doesn't arrive within this time window, assume major traffic jam or other catastrophy, ask others nearby to find the group, make introductions, and go climb).  If arriving later, just come find us on the walls.  Hopefully you can recognize us, the event Host(s) (see RSVP list) from our profile pictures, and/or check the small Whiteboard near the bathrooms and water fountain, for a description of what we're wearing that day.

Full-access Day Pass:  $22.  Students, Military or Bouldering-Only Pass:  $18.  Mondays are Ladies Night:  Women's Pass $14 after 3 PM & also special class pricing.

For membership, gear rentals, and other programs and pricing available, or for directions, check the gym website:  http://www.metrorock.com/

Frequently Asked Questions for Newbies:

Q) How do I get to the gym?

A) See website for directions: http://www.metrorock.com/ If you're driving here for the first time, it can be tricky to find MetroRock Everett, especially in the dark! Use a GPS if possible. MetroRock is in a building opposite Boston Coach.   If you don't have a vehicle, the gym offers a shuttle service from nearby Wellington T Station; call the gym for schedule details.

Q) I've never climbed at MetroRock Gym before, what do I need to do?

A) You'll need to take and pass a belay test for rope climbing. There is a separate test for toproping and sport lead climbing. For toproping, if you are not confident you can tie a re-threaded figure-8 knot and double fisherman's backup knot and safely belay a climber using an ATC device, it is highly recommended you take the Level 1 Safety class. They will not allow you to climb on ropes without passing a belay test. Call MetroRock in advance to reserve your spot in the class, and ask them about any discounts or special prices they are offering. Also, you can rent basic climbing gear (harness, shoes, belay device, etc), if needed, at the gym.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the picnic tables near bouldering area (the one furthest from cubbies if available).
results.name: MetroRock Monday

results.description:
CLICK HERE TO REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT!

About the Event:
Join former Boston resident, Dustin DiPerna, for his New England book launch. Dustin's recent release marks the culmination of a seven year journey. He has just released two groundbreaking books on Integral Religion and Spirituality. These two books, Streams of Wisdom and Evolution's Ally, trace a new path for our world's great wisdom traditions. Using explicit examples and with crystal clear vision, DiPerna shows how our world's religions can help us "Wake up" through deeper states of consciousness as well as "Grow Up" through various developmental structures of consciousness. Ultimately, DiPerna provides a pathway for religion and spirituality to have a massively positive impact on consciousness, culture, and society.

Ken Wilber has strongly endorsed both books stating: "DiPerna's work fundamentally changes the way religion and spirituality can (and should) be practiced."

Elsewhere Wilber writes: "DiPerna's offering provides a series of brilliant first steps toward a vibrant trans-lineage spirituality."

To express his full support for Dustin's work, Ken Wilber wrote the Foreword to each volume.

Please come and support Dustin as he shares his work with the Boston community. The evening will consist of lecture, group discussion, as well as meditative and inter-subjective practice. If you are interested in learning more about spirituality, integral theory, or how a deeper connection to Ultimate Reality can flourish in your life, this is an evening not to be missed!

About Dustin:

Dustin DiPerna is founder of Bright Alliance and Co-Founder of Synergy Forum He is an author, group facilitator, and meditation instructor. Dustin received a Bachelor of Science degree from Cornell University and a Master of Liberal Arts degree in Religion from Harvard University. He is author of three books: The Coming Waves, Streams of Wisdom, Evolution's Ally. In addition to being an internationally recognized expert in the field of Integral Theory, Dustin practices in the spiritual lineages of Mahamudra and Dzogchen. He lives in California with his wife, Amanda, and daughter, Jaya.

Cost: $10

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT!
results.name: A Deeper Understanding of Integral Spirituality

results.description:
(Please note: many of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending that it says on the Meetup site.)

About This Meditation Meetup

We sit in silence for around 45 minutes, followed by discussion for around 30 minutes or so. The silent sitting is interspersed with some meditation instruction, perhaps a brief reading, a little simple inquiry, exploration or movement. Sitting posture is relaxed, either on a meditation cushion or a bench. It's not a rigid practice- move whenever you need to!

We meet every Monday night, 7:30 pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House. The Friends Meeting House is located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138 You can find a very good map here: <a href="http://www.fmcquaker.org/FMC-Map_2006.pdf" target="_blank"></a>

http://fmcquaker.org/about-friends-meeting-at-cambridge/directions/

Parking is available after 6:00 in the loop off of Brattle St. that leads to the Friend's House, and there is a small lot in back of the Friend's House for those with limited mobility. After that, parking is a little tricky in Cambridge (lots of "resident only" signs), but you will find available parking on Mount Auburn St. near Friend's House and on Brattle St. as you head away from Harvard Square.

Coming by the T is a great option, with the Friend's House being a lovely 15 minute walk out of Harvard Square.

If you find you are running late, come anyway! The format is very relaxed and open— anyone interested in contemplative practice is welcome!

 

About Open Awareness Meditation Group

At the heart of these meditation sessions is the silent exploration of what we refer to as Open Awareness. We all know what it means to feel closed, limited, vulnerable, or separate. What is it like to allow ourselves to return to our natural condition of openness, presence, non-separateness and ease? This is what we explore in our meetings.

We have been meeting for over a decade, and those who lead the meditations have known each other and been practicing together for many years. They have all deeply explored a variety of traditions— for some it has been the Tibetan Buddhist practices of Dzogchen or Mahamudra, for others it has been the Indian traditions of Yoga, or Advaita, or what is currently referred to as Nonduality (some popular examples of this are Francis Lucille, Rupert Spira, Eckhart Tolle and Adyashanti). 

However all of these traditions ultimately point to the same truth, the truth of our basic awareness or presence which is beyond any tradition, practice or teaching. This is the presence we share, and the presence we are, beyond words. This is what we explore in our meetings.

This group is unique in that there is no specific guiding teacher, lama, or guru. We all meet as equals to question, share, and inspire each other to explore the Open Awareness we most deeply are. The meetings are suitable for newcomers as well as experienced meditators, and all are very welcome.
results.name: Open Awareness Meditation Group Meetup

results.description:
This summer series of Irish set dancing classes is for beginners who want to learn the basic movements of set dancing while getting a feeling of accomplishment by dancing whole sets through from beginning to end each night. These are good refresher classes for fairly-new dancers, as well, or "improvers" who want to get more familiar with the various sets. 

We welcome more experienced dancers to join in the classes, as well, but the focus is on teaching beginners; in fact, it really helps the new dancers enjoy the classes more when they have a partner who knows the steps already. We all love sharing what we know and there is great satisfaction in helping newbies learn set dancing.

We teach basic footwork and movements to specific sets during the 8 weeks of classes. We teach one set per night, figure by figure, then dance the whole set at the end of the night. By the end of the series of classes, the new dancer should have enough experience and confidence to join in any set dancing group and start to really enjoy the social and physical benefits of Irish set dancing. 

No partner is needed. Leather-soled shoes are recommended, or shoes that don't stick (most sneakers will stick), as set dancing has a lot of gliding movements. Wear comfortable clothes (think cotton t-shirts and loose pants).

The cost is $8.00 per class* - pay as you go - no need to sign up for the whole series. [*$7 per class for Harrington's regular set dancers] 

Frank and Eileen have been enthusiastically teaching beginner summer classes for several years and will continue to teach the classes, but we also have special guest teachers this summer.
results.name: Cashel Set with Mo -Beginner Irish Set Dance Class at Harrington's Summer 2015

results.description:
Perseid Meteor Shower in 2015

The 2015 Perseid meteor shower will peak around August 11. A new moon on August 14, 2015 will create perfect conditions for watching the meteor shower.

When Can I See the Perseids?

The Perseid meteor shower, one of the brighter meteor showers of the year, occur every year between July 17 and August 24. The shower tends to peak around August 9-13.

The best time to view the Perseids, or most other meteor showers is when the sky is the darkest. Most astronomers suggest that depending on the Moon’s phase, the best time to view meteor showers is right before dawn.

Comet Swift-Tuttle

Made of tiny space debris from the comet Swift-Tuttle, the Perseids are named after the constellation Perseus. This is because the direction, or radiant, from which the shower seems to come in the sky lies in the same direction as the constellation Perseus, which can be found in the north-eastern part of the sky.

While the skies light up several time a year by other meteor showers , the Perseids are widely sought after by astronomers and stargazers. This is because at its peak, one can see 60 to a 100 meteors in an hour from a dark place.

Where Can I See the Perseids?

The Perseids can be seen in the Northern Hemisphere. Look between the radiant, which will be in the north-east part of the sky and the zenith (the point in sky directly above you).

While you can easily see a shooting star with the naked eye just looking straight up, the table below shows the exact direction of the Orionids from your location. [see website]

Source(s):
http://www.timeanddate.com/astronomy/meteor-shower/perseid.html
results.name: Perseid Meteor Shower in 2015

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Tuesday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

SYNOPSIS:

In 1987, five young men, using brutally honest rhymes and hardcore beats, put their frustration and anger about life in the most dangerous place in America into the most powerful weapon they had: their music. Taking us back to where it all began, Straight Outta Compton tells the true story of how these cultural rebels—armed only with their lyrics, swagger, bravado and raw talent—stood up to the authorities that meant to keep them down and formed the world's most dangerous group, N.W.A. And as they spoke the truth that no one had before and exposed life in the hood, their voice ignited a social revolution that is still reverberating today.

Straight Outta Compton stars O'Shea Jackson Jr., Corey Hawkins and Jason Mitchell as Ice Cube, Dr. Dre and Eazy-E, and is directed by F. Gary Gray (Friday, Set It Off, The Italian Job). The drama is produced by original N.W.A members Ice Cube and Dr. Dre, who are joined by fellow producers Tomica Woods-Wright, Matt Alvarez, Gray and Scott Bernstein. Will Packer serves as executive producer of the film alongside Adam Merims, David Engel, Bill Straus, Thomas Tull and Jon Jashni.

Rated R

Read more: http://www.jamn945.com/contests/jamn-945-sneak-screening-straight-outta-compton-the-story-of-nwa/388772#ixzz3hmUqacdw

Cloud Foundry is a popular Platform as a Service open source project. Supported by a fast growing community, Cloud Foundry is being adopted by many Fortune 500 companies that are keen to deliver CI & CD to their developers. To leverage the rich functionality of Cloud Foundry, we modified Diego (Cloud Foundry cluster manger) to use Mesos as a resource manger.

results.description:
Thank you in advance to BlueMetal and Joe Grenier, Senior Software Engineer, for sponsoring food and hosting this meetup.

http://bluemetal.com/Company/Boston

Presentations:

Presentation:
Microservice Architectures and Using AWS to Build “server-less” Micro Services.
The microservice approach to architecting software has taken off in the last few years. Microservices are increasingly being used on cloud based platforms to realize the goals of increased agility in developing software and increased scalability and resiliency in running it (Netflix and Nike have both used AWS to deploy and manage microservice architectures). We’ll take a look at some of the characteristics of a microservice, discuss the pros and cons, and see how to use Amazon’s new API Gateway service and AWS Lambda to build “server-less” micro services.

Speaker:
Joe Grenier is a Senior Software Engineer with BlueMetal Architects. In more than 15 years in IT he has worked across a variety of industries, including finance, health care, e-commerce and non-profit. Joe is a member of the Cloud and Services practice at BlueMetal where he focuses on hybrid-cloud architectures, disaster recovery and dev-ops, mainly on AWS and Azure.

====================

Presentation:
Compare and Contrast AWS API Gateway
As the API economy continues to explode, organizations are having to consider governance of their APIs to effectively manage consumption. Software solutions from companies like Apigee, Mulesoft, WSO2 have been options in the API Management space for several years now. On July 9th, Amazon jumped into the fray to provide their own API Management solution called API Gateway. This session provide a contrast and comparison of both WSO2 API Manager and AWS API Gateway including an overview of features such as: Security, Message Throttling, Message Proxying, Audit Logs, Consumption Lifecycle, Publishing Lifecycle, Cost

Speaker:
Chris Riley is a founding Partner at HKM and has focused on the services and integration space since 1995 in a variety of pilot, implementation and training roles with companies such as PTC, IBM, Workday(formerly Cape Clear) and SOA Systems. In his various capacities, Chris has also been a speaker and contributor at QCon, SOA Symposium, ECAUG, Prentice Hall Podcasts and Toronto JUG along with publications in SOA Magazine and SOA Design Patterns. Currently Chris is supporting Fortune 500 companies in APIs, Devops, cloud computing, and governance as part of their IT Strategy.


Contact Mark Annati, the moderator, at [masked] with interest in sponsoring (food, location) or presenting at a future meetup. Thank you.

results.description:
Have you always wanted to run a little stronger, a little faster, and have some motivated people around to help push you along? Well now you can have all of those things at the best Track workout ever.

Interest peaked? Read on for more details including the weekly workout.

Meet at the Harvard Track as usual. See what the workout will be below.


View Larger Map

The workout is a simple speed workout designed to add some variety to your run.

The rest of this details the workout and highlights a few things I think are important to remember. Skip it if you would rather just wing it and meet us at the track. We'll fill you in there.

If you have never run on a track before, don't worry if none of this makes sense right now. As much as I will try to prep you, it usually just takes a few laps around the track for all of this to sink in.

The Workout

The workouts vary on a weekly basis and are usually interval based. We sometimes do workouts that are fun and different. Come see what this weeks workout is!

What does that mean?

1. The distances (200, 400, 800, etc.) are the distances we run on the track. Each lap around the track is 400 meters.

2. Each lap is supposed to be run at a certain speed, based on your 5k pace. Don't know what your 5k pace is? Read my instructions below to calculate your 5k pace.

*3. The recovery interval (RI), which is indicated in parentheses, may be a specified timed interval or a distance that you walk/jog.

Things to remember

Track workouts are supposed to be FUN! Don't be intimidated or dread a track workout. This is supposed to be a fun supplement to your other "normal" runs. With all of us out there encouraging each other it should be a blast.

Bring a running stopwatch/wristwatch if you have one! Using the start/lap/stop function will help you pace yourself on each lap.

Don't push it! If something hurts or starts to feel tight, don't risk an injury because you ran too hard on your first track workout of the summer. We have plenty of time to ease in...

Bring water for the end!!!

5k pace instructions

Decide how fast you would like to run a 5k. Choose a time that is reasonable yet challenging. Convert that time to seconds, and divide the seconds by 12.5 (the number of 400 meter laps it takes to run 5k). That is your 5k pace.

As an example, I might decide a reasonable yet challenging goal time for a 5k is 24 minutes.

24 minutes x 60 seconds per minute = 1440 seconds

1440 seconds divided by 12.5 laps in a 5k ~= 115 seconds / lap

This means that I will run the workout according to a pace of 115 seconds / lap.

I will also have pacing charts available at the track, so don't fret.

Blog
results.name: Track Tuesday

results.description:
Winner of the 2015 Pulitzer Prize for Fiction


Marie-Laure lives with her father in Paris near the Museum of Natural History, where he works as the master of its thousands of locks. When she is six, Marie-Laure goes blind and her father builds a perfect miniature of their neighborhood so she can memorize it by touch and navigate her way home. When Marie-Laure is twelve, the Nazis occupy Paris, and father and daughter flee to the walled citadel of Saint-Malo, where Marie-Laure’s reclusive great-uncle lives in a tall house by the sea. With them they carry what might be the museum’s most valuable and dangerous jewel.

In a mining town in Germany, the orphan Werner grows up with his younger sister, enchanted by a crude radio they find. Werner becomes an expert at building and fixing these crucial new instruments, a talent that wins him a place at a brutal academy for Hitler Youth, then a special assignment to track the resistance. More and more aware of the human cost of his intelligence, Werner travels through the heart of the war and, finally, into Saint-Malo, where his story and Marie-Laure’s converge. -via goodreads.com


Please support our host restaurant! Bar Lola has delicious drinks and tapas. Order at the bar and then join us in the back room.

The Gift: Can you really go through life having never wronged anyone? In the chilling psychological thriller The Gift, Simon (Jason Bateman, Horrible Bosses) and Robyn (Rebecca Hall, The Town) are a young married couple whose life is going just as planned until a chance encounter with an acquaintance from Simon’s high school sends their world into a harrowing tailspin. Simon doesn’t recognize Gordo (writer/director Joel Edgerton) at first, but after a series of uninvited encounters and mysterious gifts prove troubling, a horrifying secret from the past is uncovered after more than 20 years. As Robyn learns the unsettling truth about what happened between Simon and Gordo, she starts to question: how well do we really know the people closest to us, and are past bygones ever really bygones?
results.name: Movie Night: The Gift

results.description:
Our inaugural meeting! (Over time, I'd like to see us host our discussions, but I don't see a bar or restaurant as a bad place to meet at first first.)

This month, let's discuss Greece. The ongoing crisis has implications for the success of the European integration project, and raises a number of other interesting questions. What does it say about the state of current global financial governance? Are critics like Joseph Stiglitz and Paul Krugman right that a focus on austerity is single minded, or are proponents of austerity correct that "shock therapy" is the key to long-term macroeconomic stability? Are IMF structural adjustment programs, in general, geared for the ways countries actually have developed historically? Let's discuss these and other issues over some good food and drinks!

UPDATE 8/2: I'm just going to set the official time 15 min early so everybody has time to get there for our 7pm reservation. Plus, it leaves some time for a bit of foyer talk.
results.name: Monthly Salon - Greece, the IMF, and How Countries Develop

results.description:
"Windows to the Past: Discovering History Through Tangible Things" Join us for a series of interactive discussions that complement the free HarvardX course, Tangible Things. The online course, led by Harvard Professor Laurel Thatcher Ulrich, introduces an understanding of how people make history through objects—the things they gather, create, collect, exhibit, exchange, throw away, or ignore.

This in-person discussion series is intended to allow anyone--from the casually interested, to antique collectors, to museum professionals--to work together in person, ask questions, and engage with real life objects. Participants will assess fascinating objects from Harvard’s collections, as well as from the kinds of collections found in your very own attic, to see how any material thing, when examined closely, can be a link between the present and past.

This series is free and open to the public. Please RSVP online through Eventbrite (http://hvrd.me/QfJAt). Refreshments will be served.
results.name: "Tangible Things" Interactive Discussion

results.description:
In most meditations, thoughts are considered a distraction. In this meditation, after an initial period to settle the mind, we'll actually make thoughts the object of our meditation.

We'll start with 20 minutes of meditation in which we settle the mind by paying mindful attention to the breath, ambient sound, or whatever meditation you choose to do.

Then, we'll sit for another five minutes, observing the mind as thoughts rise to attention. Ideally, we won't get hooked by these thoughts, but will observe mindfully as the thoughts come and go.

After the meditation, we'll have a discussion. 

There is no charge for the meditation, and there is nothing you need to bring.

We wrap up around 8:30. You are invited to join us for a bite to eat afterwards in Harvard Square (usually at Cafe Algiers).
results.name: Mindfulness of Thoughts

results.description:
Contact me [Jose (click the link, then click "Message")] for the address.

General board gaming. We have a good library of widely played board games, and people normally bring many more of them. We regularly run three to five tables of board games - this provides enough variety.  It is normal for people to get two or three games a session.  The game night format was inspired by Unity Games and the event is very casual and structureless.  If you have gone to one of the meetup's quarterly events you will know.

Q & A:

Q.  What types of games are played?
A.  Any type of board game.  Browse through the most popular games at http://boardgamegeek.com/ and that should give you an idea.

Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm?
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  Should I bring something?  
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served. Feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/sodas in the pizza cup. 

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game, can we schedule it?
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want. 

Q.  Where do I park?
A.  The driveway is the obvious spot, but eventually it will fill up on most of these game nights.  Some people do park on the street.  The soccer field parking across the street is a safe option and is the suggestion the town police gave me when I asked about overflow parking.
results.how_to_find_us: The house is just across from a soccer field.  If the driveway starts to fill up, the soccer field parking lot is a good option.
results.name: Board Games in Sudbury

results.description:
Next up is Snowpiercer, volumes 1 & 2. I have no idea what to expect. See you there!

The Bumf:

From fearsome engine to final car, all surviving human life is here: a complete hierarchy of the society we lost. The elite, as ever, travel in luxury at the front of the train – but for those in the rear coaches, life is squalid, miserable and short. Now the poor have had enough: it’s time to seize control of the engine – and their future!

If you plan on coming, once you've read the book please post one discussion question in the comments for this event. I'll bring a list of them with me, and as usual we'll have them there to draw from when we're looking for stuff to talk about. I won't turn you away if you don't, but let's make running these things a group effort!

For those who haven't been to the Comic Book Club before, it's pretty simple - we sit around, order some food and some drink, and we probe deep into the merits and meanings of our chosen book or books. I also bring along a list of questions (written by you!) to give the discussion a bit of structure - but don't worry - it's pretty casual!

The venue is the Friendly Toast, which is a very casual kinda place with plenty of room where we can easily be heard. Please note though, that it's best to bring cash - although supposedly their card minimum has been relaxed - perhaps even obliterated!
results.how_to_find_us: We gather on the couches in the front beforehand, and once we have a quorum we get a table -- usually one of the booths or the tables in the very back if it's a large group. Ask the staff if you can't find us!
results.name: Snowpiercer, volumes 1 & 2

results.description:
Camera settings and facial expressions are all useful things to know when making portraits but unless you know how to pose your subject the resulting photograph can look totally wrong.

While I have taught introductory classes on posing this is the first time I have offered an in-depth intensive series on posing that presents in  a systematic approach  the accumulated skill and knowledge of over forty years of experience. 

It goes way beyond anything you learned in the  introductory class.

The workshop takes place over three Tuesday evening  sessions: 

Aug 18 individual poses - the spine and the feet which are the key to good poses

August 25  hands, arms, shoulders and heads - the fine tuning

step 1 - couples and groups  - putting it all together 

The cost is $125 for the three sessions and class size is limited.

(You must sign up for the series - attending individual classes is not an option as the series presents a unique posing system where knowledge of the previous class will be necessary for the understanding of the subsequent classes).

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships

 

 


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.


Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time. I have very limited access to the internet and that can make it difficult for me to respond to emails. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

 

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

These classes are not affiliated with any church or religion.

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind


·  Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power

·  Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships

·  Learn to work constructively with your own emotions

·  Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities

·  Develop new resources and capabilities

·  Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.

Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.

Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses

Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.

Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.

Discover the passion and power that resides within you

Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind

We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.

Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

Alternate Tuesdays at 7:30 PM at Unity of Somerville, located at 6 William Street at the corner of College Avenue

Call (913)[masked] to learn more

He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful. 

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog

results.description:
This event is a webinar https://youtu.be/lxdV4y1fBTs

Crowdfunding and Fan Funding are having a renaissance in the world of film. Crowdfunding is a concept that has existed since the time of Mozart. Yet, filmmakers at all levels are using it to make shorts, YouTube channels, indie films (example: Spike Lee, Documentaries), and even being used by big budget filmmakers like Simon West (The Expendables 2, Con Air).

Ronjini Joshua, founder of The Silver Telegram, a PR company specializing in crowdfunding will discuss how to prepare for a perk based (non-equity) crowdfunding campaign. The Silver Telegram is an official Indiegogo partner and has raised over $3,000,000 on crowdfunding projects on sites like Kickstarter and Indiegogo. Ronjini, will share insight about the outlook on crowdfunding, it's importance in helping launch innovative ideas, and offer tips on how to prepare for a successful crowdfunding campaign.

results.description:
Containers and microservices have been around for years in one form or another, but it wasn't until Docker was launched two years ago that the industry finally caught fire with an open platform for running containers.

Containers and Docker are heralded as revolutionizing DevOps and the way applications are built and managed in the cloud (and traditional datacenters). Companies are adopting containers at rapidly increasing rates and the landscape is evolving rapidly.

Is running many containers on a host OS which may itself often be virtualized setting ourselves up for catastrophic failure? What does this mean for the generation that has grown up managing VMs?

Are we moving towards an entire industry shift or will there be a plateau and/or retreat?

Join us for a candid discussion of where we were, where we are, and where we're going as we push towards continuous release with containers.

Registration required at this site (no registrations accepted via the Meetup):
http://www.masstlc.org/events/event_details.asp?id=664222&group=

IBM's product manager for Containers, Kimi Cousins will be a panelist. To learn more about 'Blue Containers' visit: https://developer.ibm.com/bluemix/2015/06/22/ibm-containers-on-bluemix/

New to Bluemix? Start here to register for your free account: www.ibm.biz/cloudboston
results.name: Special event with MassTLC: Containers, DevOps and the Cloud

results.description:
Do you want OTHER people to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely from this meetup or others: Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill
Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street, Mission Hill, Roxbury
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops)
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T
Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"! 
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.


Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).

We arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop - <2 blocks away), behind the long wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Please e-mail organizer with your e-mail address and cellphone (in case we need to converse about this more, or contact you before the event).


Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share' 
buttons

Mon & Wed: 6pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.  
Sat: 11am - 1pm, meet 10.45am by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.

Price: New paddler 2-class pack for $10. All other paddlers paddle unlimited under the $110 annual membership fee. New paddlers who have purchased the $10 intro pack get a $10 deduction from $110 membership!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather! Be prepared to get wet!

Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards.  
Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended.  
Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen.

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locker provided on-site.

Please sign our e-Waiver before you get on the water

Hope to see you there!

Lily[masked]

Program details:  TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fund-raising program. We train runners for their full or half marathon races and runners raise donations for AID and Asha. Both beginner and experienced runners are welcome. Anyone is welcome to RSVP and join us for the group runs up to four time with no obligations. If you missed the information session you can get an overview of this training and fund-raising program from here.

Looking for more runners: We are always looking for more runners. If any of your friends, family members or colleagues to give us a try and join this meetup group.


Waiver: Lawyers make us do this :-).  By running with TeamAIDAsha program you are agreeing to our official waiver at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/waiver.html


About AID-Boston

Association for India's Development (AID) is a non-profit, volunteer movement committed to promoting sustainable, equitable and just development, especially at India’s grassroots. We meet once a week at MIT. Anyone is welcome to attend. Visit AID-Boston at: www.aidboston.org

About Asha-MIT

Asha tries to catalyze socio-economic change in India through education of underprivileged children. We meet once a month at MIT. Anyone is welcome to attend. Visit Asha Boston/MIT at: http://www.ashanet.org/mit/

results.description:
Please join me for a repeat of last year's 20- and 30-something evening of good wine, food and conversation at the unique pair of "localvore" restaurants EVOO and Za in Kendall Square Cambridge.

We'll start the evening with a Meet & Greet in the high table area of the bar that bridges the two restaurants. The RSVP fee includes tasting portions from 4 wines with assorted New England cheese, charcuterie, seafood and other nibbles, tax and tip included. Relaxed, informal wine and food tasting -- novice or expert, you will enjoy it.


Afterwards about 8:30pm, those who are interested can join us for a sit-down dinner at EVOO. NOTE: $$ for dinner is NOT included in RSVP; the menu has medium and large entrees, so the choice is up to you. Last time we did this event those that stayed for dinner just had an entree with another glass of wine, so the total tab per person came to about $25 + $25 = $50 each.

About age restriction. We occasionally do age-specific events like this one to encourage new members to come out and see what the group is all about. Please keep the age restriction in mind when you RSVP.

COST

PRICE: $25 payable with your RSVP

Usual BostonWine refund policy applies. I will offer a full refund up to 24-hours prior to the event. Space is limited, so please don't RSVP unless you know that you can attend. RSVP fee is for Meet and Greet only--dinner is optional and extra cost.

POLICIES

Limited to 15 total including +1s. I may promote newbies up from wait list. Everyone must be a member of BostonWine and pay in advance. RSVP early, but please don't RSVP unless you're sure that you can make it.

NOTE: As part of the RSVP process you will be asked to accept the group's Policies and Disclaimer (use a new web browser window to see the About Us section of our group's home page). You must answer "Yes" in this event's RSVP to attend. (Note, apparently some versions of the Meetup mobile app don't display this question -- in that case, RSVP with your phone and then use a web browser later on to update your RSVP). 

WHAT TO BRING 

Yourself! Food and wine will be provided.

WHERE

The event will be held in the bar area that bridges the two restaurants ZA and EVOO. 

EVOO, an acronym for Extra Virgin Olive Oil, serves eclectic New American cuisine. The restaurant was named Best Eclectic Restaurant in Boston for several years running by Zagat.

ZA is the sister restaurant specializing in  pizza and salads. The bar joins the two restaurants and serves both menus. 

EVOO
ZA

350 3rd Street
Kendall Square
Cambridge, MA
(617)[masked]

T: Red line, Kendall Square (3 minute walk)

Parking: Kendall Square South Garage, reduced rate if validated

This promises to be a fun event. I look forward to seeing you!

-Jim

results.description:
Join us for a tour of the Tufts University bee research field site! Rachael Bonoan, Kelsey Graham and Nick Dorian are Tufts students researching bees in the Boston area! They are excited to take us on a tour of their apiaries and introduce us to the research they are conducting, including investigations on honey bee nutrition and brood development, bumble bee population dynamics and how an invasive bee (the wool carder bee) affects foraging behavior of a native bumble bee.

We will meet right across from the Tufts University Steve Tisch Sports & Fitness Center (161 College Ave, Medford, MA) and then head over to the field site together. At the field site, we will get a chance to check out 14 different field bumble bee hives (for those who were able to come last year, there are a lot more bumbles this year!), 1 lab-reared bumble bee hive (if all goes well), and 7 observation honey bee hives.
results.name: Tufts Research Apiary Visit 2015

results.description:
Boston Traders' Meetup

You are invited to attend the monthly Boston Traders' Meetup meetings.

The format for the monthly meetings is that each person will introduce her- or himself and state the market that he or she trades and perhaps a very brief description of the approach taken. For example, an introduction could be, "Hi, my name is Fred Hampton and I trade forex breakouts during the London session."

From there, the floor is open for people to discuss anything about trading. You may talk about something you learned recently about trading or about an obstacle that you are facing in trading or make a request for resources from other members.

Please print out and bring this BostonTradersMeetup sign so you can connect with the other members easily.
www.meetup.com/BostonTraders/files/

Part of the purpose of this group is for people to connect with other traders so it's encouraged for people to exchange contact info. For example, if you are an options trader and another options trader talks about a topic that interests you, then feel free to ask the person if she or he would like to exchange contact info.

--------------------


This meeting is located in the Starbucks inside what is called the "Boston Marriott" even though the hotel is located in Kendall Square, Cambridge. The Kendall Square subway stop is a Red Line stop at "Kendall."

This meeting is FREE and it repeats on the 2nd Wednesday of every month.
results.name: Boston Traders' Meetup Group Meeting 2nd Wednesday at 6 PM in Cambridge

results.description:
Working with the DOM can often be a frustrating experience, resulting in poor performance and hard-to-track bugs. Modern JS frameworks have sought to make this better, but often ignore server-side integration unless you run JavaScript on the server. But your server infrastructure shouldn’t be dictated by your client-side library choices.

This talk presents the insights we learned while building a virtual DOM powered UI library that integrates with PHP by using a common template language</a>, a unified data model, and <a href="https://github.com/jashkenas/backbone">shared view components. The result was Tungsten.js, a JS framework that aims to deliver a better user and developer experience.


SPEAKERS

Andrew Rota

Andrew is a front-end software engineer who specializes in building JavaScript web applications. He is currently a JavaScript Engineer at Wayfair in Boston.

Follow Andrew on Twitter: @andrewrota

Matt DeGennaro

Matt is a software engineer who specializes in front-end and eCommerce technologies. Matt spends his days building advanced JavaScript web applications and is currently a JavaScript Engineer at Wayfair in Boston.

Follow Matt on Twitter: @thedeeg
results.name: Better PHP-Frontend Integration With Tungsten.js

results.description:
Git 101: Git and GitHub for Beginners

Join us for an introduction to git, the version control software used by companies and open source projects worldwide, led by HubSpot software engineers Meghan Nelson and Ollie Banis.


We'll discuss how to make a commit, make a branch, and merging into a master branch, and break into small groups to simulate a team project using git. With time permitting we'll explore more advanced topics like stashing commits, rebasing, and the reference logs (reflogs). Be sure to bring a laptop and an appetite!
results.name: Git 101: Git and GitHub for Beginners

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

A number of folks living NORTH of Boston have asked about an ASL SOCIAL. Let's make this happen!

On WEDNESDAYS, starting October 29 - 6pm to 8pm - I / we will be at the NORTH SHORE MALL Food Court.

While technology has improved the way people communicate, "Deaf Social Clubs" are slowly disappearing. This is a way to start bringing REAL social interaction back!

Please join us for a casual, relaxed, no-pressure two-hour Social, where we can chat, tell stories, get to know each other, and meet new people (or old friends!). Friends, Fun and Food!

A warm welcome is extended to all Deaf & non-Deaf people: folks in the Deaf Community, CODA's, Interpreters, ASL students, parents of deaf children AND their children, ASL professors/teachers, Relay Operators, Deaf services workers- EVERYONE!

This will be a "SOME ASL KNOWLEDGE and ABOVE" Social, because not all of us are ASL-fluent! "Voices- Off" -- we'll all laugh & learn WITH and FROM each other!

WHAT: ASL SOCIAL CLUB
WHERE: North Shore Mall Food Court, PEABODY,MA
DAY/TIME: Wednesdays, 6pm - 8pm
WHY: To meet like-minded people, socialize using ASL, tell stories, and have good time!
WHO: Anyone who wants to chat using American Sign Language!
HOW TO FIND US:  We'll be sitting on the couches closest to the "walkway" side of the Food Court, not hidden inside the food court, so easier to locate us!

If you have any question, please contact Connie or Paul I., through the EMAIL LINK via BOSTON ASL profile page.

PLEASE, if you would be good enough, RSVP either "YES" or "NO" so I know who to look for!

CHEERS!

Connie Cassidy / Paul I.

PEACE...
results.why: ASL is the third largest "foreign language" in the U.S.; ASL is fun to use; ASL is NOT English, but does "borrow" from the English language.
results.how_to_find_us: The folks talking with their hands!
results.name: Weekly North Shore ASL Social!

The Revolve Nation's Boston Entrepreneurs Network is the largest community of entrepreneurs and business owners in the city of Boston, offering networking, discussion groups, seminars, business plan hot-seats, and more!

Join us here, where professionals and entrepreneurs meet in mutual support of business to network, socialize, learn, and promote a thriving community of entrepreneurs. Wine and snacks provided!

Schedule:

6pm-6:30pm  -- Open Networking over wine and snacks

6:30-6:45pm  -- Meeting Called to Order and Introductions

6:45--7:45pm -- Open discussions on topics of interest to our members (examples; Getting funded, building a team, using mailing lists and their effectiveness, firing a difficult employee) Suggest your own topics as comments on the event, or simply bring them with you!

7:45-8:00pm  -- More Networking! (and wine!)

Like anything in life, what you put into a networking group is what you get out of it. The Boston Entrepreneurs Group is designed for entrepreneurs and professionals who are serious about building their business, investing in relationships, and helping each other to succeed.

The way the group seeks to achieve these outcomes:

1) Regular attendance

2) Dedication to coming prepared to contribute value to the community with expertise, experience, and networks.

3) Create a fun and supportive environment!

Price: FREE

SPONSORS: Revolve, Inc.: www.revolvethis.com

Exemplar Law: www.exemplarcompanies.com

See you soon!

results.description:
Talk:

Hybrid Mobile Apps with Ionic & Firebase

Ionic makes it possible to build awesome hybrid mobile apps using Cordova and Angular. With Firebase, you can easily store and sync data for your Ionic app without setting up a server or writing any backend code. In this talk, Mike and Sara will give an overview of Firebase and show you how easy it is to set up with Ionic. They'll end the talk with some live coding!

Bios:

Sara is a Developer Advocate at Firebase, where she helps with developer relations through online content, outreach and events. She's passionate about learning to code, running, and finding the best ice cream in SF.


Mike is an Ionic core team member, developer advocate, and Firebase expert. I work with developers while they're building their app and also speak about Ionic/hybird apps. Hybrid app maker, occasional musician, and craft beer lover. Based in Providence, RI.


------------------

Note: Unfortunately, we can no longer welcome recruiters and hiring professionals to the meetups. 

------------------ 


Schedule:

• 5:45 If you have time, we need people to help set up the room


• 6:00 Doors open. Networking. Soda and beer available. 

• 6:45 Announcements


• 7:00 Featured Talk + Q&A

• 8:00 Wrap-up, networking, good-bye

------------------

While the Cengage website lists 20 Channel Center Street, please use the 10 Channel Center Street entrance.

Address: 10 Channel Center Street - 3rd Floor South Boston, MA 02210

Google Maps:  https://www.google.com/maps/place/10+Channel+Center+St/@42.345056,-71.0519167,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x89e37a7dc3c3589d:0x11ddd2541614f619

Public Transit: Broadway Station (Redline). From Broadway Station, Head southeast on W Broadway toward A St for 120 yards Go North (take a left) onto A Street for .3 miles We have entrances to the building on A Street and on Channel Center Street.

From South Station (Commuter Rail and Redline) Take the white Channel Center shuttle from in front of the Federal Reserve Bank OrTake Summer Street over the channel for .3 miles Turn right on Melchor Street for .1 miles Turn right on A Street for .3 miles We have entrances to the building on A Street and on Channel Center Street.

Parking: http://en.parkopedia.com/parking/20_channel_center_street_boston_ma/ Watch out for the meters, most of them switch to "Resident Only" parking at 6pm.

We have a limited amount of reserved parking across the street. Please message the coordinators.

results.description:
Are you new to coding and need to learn an essential skill that will keep you in demand and place you ahead of the curve in the tech world? Ever make changes that broke your code and forgot how it was working before? Want to work together with someone on a code project, but aren't sure who has the latest version of a particular file? Version control can solve these and many other problems! 

Version control is an essential skill for any web or software developer to manage their code base, keep track of changes, and coordinate major revisions with other team members. Git is the fastest growing and most popular open source version control system used today. It's useful whether you are working on a large distributed team or working on smaller personal projects.

This session will introduce the basics of version control, how to use Git to keep track of your changes to a project, and using GitHub (a social code hosting service) to collaborate with other developers.

Prior coding experience is not necessary in order to take this class, just a willingness to learn something new!

CLASS DATES

This class takes place over two consecutive Wednesday evenings, as follows:

Wednesday, August 12 - 6:30pm to 8:30pm 
Wednesday, August 19 - 6:30pm to 8:30pm 

Your payment registers you for the entire series.

Note: This class will be limited to 20 students. Register early to secure your spot. 

TAKEAWAYS

This class will be broken up into two sections. The first section we will cover:

• the basics of the command line interface

• the basic concepts of version control

• fundamental git commands to track changes to a small project 

• the basics of collaborating on code with other developers

• how to use GitHub

The second section will be a lab where we will put our knowledge to practice pushing and pulling our code to/from Github as well as contributing to a sample repository. We will also spend time in the lab getting your questions answered and resolving any issues you may come across from the first part of class.

LOCATION

Both classes will take place at Velir: 

212 Elm St. 
Somerville, MA 02144

Thank you to Velir for being a supporter of Girl Develop It!

PREREQS & PREPARATION 

This class will not use actual code when committing to a GitHub repository, so no need to worry about knowing a particular programming language. A willingness to use the command line to execute commands is necessary but a brief intro/review will be provided. We will be changing directories, listing directory contents, and using git from command line throughout the class.

Here are the slides for the class.

Tech Requirements:

• Your laptop (Mac, PC, or Linux are all okay)

• A modern web browser - either Chrome or Firefox with Firebug installed. 

• A text editor. We recommend Sublime Text 2 (it's free and available for both Mac and PC).

FINANCIAL NEED

A limited number of scholarships are available for those with a financial hardship. To apply, click here. Scholarship applicants will be notified shortly after the deadline. Class capacity does not impact scholarship students. Check out this info sheet about getting course fees covered by your employer.


YOUR TEACHER

Kate is the web developer at Tufts University's Tisch Library.  She was as a librarian at a medical school where the favorite part of her job was running the database-driven website, and was thrilled to get hired on at the main library at Tufts to do web development full-time. 3 years later, she is still pretty excited about it. 

Kate has a masters in information studies from UT Austin, meaning she is a librarian and schooled in information architecture and database management. She wouldn't be a web developer without the help of some brilliant and encouraging women (and men) along the way, and is happy/required-by-librarian-values to share whatever knowledge she's gained so far. 

She's also grateful to developers who encouraged her to use git & github - she wouldn't want to do any web-work without the safety net of version control again, and git & github make the process pretty easy. She's been using git for over a year and git has saved her **s plenty of times.
results.name: Intro to Github & Version Control Using Git

Come join David and friends for a night of Magic: The Gathering over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford. This event is part of our "Wednesday Night Magic" series.

It doesn't matter if you are an expert "planeswalker", or don't know anything about Magic: The Gathering -- you can come to play or learn this amazing strategy game.  There are usually between 6-12 people at each event, consisting of all experience levels.  All decks of all types are welcome for this "casual play" event.  Beginners who want to learn are welcome!

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. From Kirk:  No alcohol, big tarps(why???), liquids must be a clear plastic containers not to exceed 2 liters in size, no cans, very small personal bags only....I'm sure there's more but those are the key ones I found. 7/31 Update: Backpacks, after being checked, are allowed.


2015 “Tips for Attending”

Packing a Picnic and Other Tips for Enjoying Your Experience at the DCR’s Hatch Shell

Make the perfect dish – the choice is yours.Put all the food in a see through bag – it will be faster to get through security and coolers on wheels are a “no-no.”Use sealed plastic containers for beverages. Alcohol is not allowed at any DCR park.Bring your folding or beach chair, if you’d like, but you’re also welcome to rent a folding chair at the Landmarks Information Tent.Spread the goodies out on a blanket or tarp. Be sure it’s no bigger than 10’ x 12’.Gates open at 5:30 PM, so come early for a great spot. There are entrances near the Hatch Shell, at the foot of the Arthur Fiedler Bridge and one near the concession stand. If you aren’t carrying anything, go through the “No Bags” express line.Bathrooms are on site behind the Hatch Shell.Take the T. Arlington and Charles Street stations are the closest. There is no parking on Storrow Drive, but there is a handicapped drop-off point. Paid parking is available at the LAZ Parking Lot at the Mass. Eye and Ear Infirmary and the Boston Common Garage.Bring your kids in strollers or on foot and give them an opportunity to conduct in the Maestro Zone.Check the weather the day of the concert on this page starting at 4 pm, or with our partners at 

WCVB TV

results.description:
This 8-hour class covers JavaScript and basic programming concepts. These materials cover basic programming concepts like variables, data types, and functions, if/then statements, arrays and loops. They also introduce the Document Object Model (DOM) and how to use JavaScript to interact with the DOM and change HTML pages.


This series takes place over four consecutive Wednesday evenings, as follows:

August 12th - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

August 19th - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

August 26th - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

September 2nd - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

Your payment registers you for the entire series.

Note: This class will be limited to 25 students. Register early to secure your spot.

PREREQS & PREPARATION

Familiarity with HTML and CSS is assumed for this class - you don't need to be an expert, but an understanding of tags, attributes and how to they interact with CSS are needed to fully participate. This course is specifically for beginners and we highly advise experienced JS developers to not take this class.

Please bring along a laptop and charger as well as have the following programs installed prior to arriving:

Sublime Text 2: http://www.sublimetext.com/2

Google Chrome: https://www.google.com/chrome/browser/desktop/index.html


LOCATION

All four classes will take place at Jana, located at:

141 Tremont, 4th Floor, Boston, MA


FINANCIAL NEED

A limited number of scholarships are available for those with a financial hardship. To apply, click here. Scholarship applicants will be notified shortly after the deadline. Check out this info sheet about getting course fees covered by your employer.

YOUR TEACHER


Alicia Sedlock is a web developer and conference speaker. She has been developing web sites and applications for over five years, with a focus on front-end technologies like JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. When she's not programming, she loves playing video games and brewing hard cider. She currently works for Society of Grownups in Brookline.


TEACHING ASSISTANTS

If you are interested in being a teaching assistant for this workshop, please contact an event host. TAing is a great way to practice what you know and to get to know members of our community.


All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct.
results.name: JS101 - Intro to JavaScript (4-class series)

General guidelines: Dress accordingly. Bring a white & dark shirt so we can easily divide into 2 teams. Have plenty of water. Sunscreen on a sunny day. Stretch & warm up. We'll provide discs and cones.

Weather: Rain in New England is unpredictable. We will send out a final notice one hour before start time if cancellation is necessary.

About: Playing Ultimate is all about good sportsmanship, respect, and gracefulness on the field.  Fun & having a good time is a must above anything else. It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field.  Open to all levels of players.  Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.

results.description:
More Great Speeches: Wed, Aug 12.

Did you ever imagine speaking could be fun?

Our last Meet-up in July won rave reviews again from first-time guests. They enjoyed the simple exercises and discovered the basics of speaking to a group.

Our meet-ups are fast-paced and entertaining. Nobody feels intimidated. Come experience it for yourself: You'll get to listen to prepared speeches and learn useful speaking tips.


You are welcome to participate in our two-minute impromptu speaking exercises, but certainly not required. We do have a 30-second “Round Robin” that everyone participates in (it’s fun and easy), and you’ll probably be asked to introduce yourself [talk very briefly about an interest, or what brought you there]. Pretty basic, no surprises.  The only requirement is to enjoy yourself and get a sense of how the meet-ups run. [They start promptly at 6:50, so please arrive by 6:45. They end by 8:30 pm.]


Mark Your Calendar - Our Next Meet-Ups:


Wed, Aug 26 (6:45 PM)

(Don't park in the supermarket/Porter Square shopping center parking lot.)

results.description:
Mike Messier is an experienced Filmmaker, Screenwriter, Actor, having worked with Meryl Streep & Elisabeth Shue (in Hope Springs) and Cybill Shepherd, Mario Van Peebles and Wesley Snipes (in Hard Luck). Mike has lead the acclaimed C.O.R.E. A.C.T.I.N.G. and Tao Zen Acting workshops for six years and helped several students accomplish their goals and advance their careers. Mike is also an award winning filmmaker, having won a regional Associated Press Award (as Associate Producer for a documentary about Haiti) among other accomplishments. His recent work titled The Nature of the Flame is described as "thought-provoking, imaginative, and hypnotizing" by Video Views.


Mike is currently in development for the film Distance from Avalon, which Mike describes as a "Biblical-Vampire Epic". Mike also seeks funding for the long term projects Chris and the Coffee Girl (comedy with Playboy Cover Girl Maria Kanellis and Pro Wrestler Raven attached) as well as Wrestling with Sanity (psychological drama with Pro Wrestler Raven among others).

More of Mike's work can be found at www.mikemessier.com andwww.taozenacting.com
